Dear Local Residents,
My name is Patrick Lambert and I am very fortunate to have lived in the great community of Norham with my wife since 2016. I am standing for Reform UK in the County council elections on the 1st of May.
Like yourselves when we pay our Council Tax, I am incredibly frustrated with the state of our local services and keep wondering what we are getting for our ever-increasing monthly contributions.
Our communities and isolated hamlets in Norham & Islandshires are very much at the end of the line when the NCC is deciding on its priorities down in County Hall in Morpeth. We need Change and a fresh outlook that puts local Peoples priorities at the head of the queue, delivering actual results not just empty rhetoric from the old party consensus.
I am setting out 3 areas we must concentrate our efforts on:
-
Deliver Value for Money for Council Tax & business rate Payers. Cut out Waste and Vanity projects and make sure NCC is operating within a Budget that delivers for the those that pay the bills rather than those that live off the back of NCC.
-
Help and encourage small business in our communities. Rather than an economy that has become addicted to carrier vans and out of town retail outlets, we need to get back to supporting local enterprises and creating employment opportunities for our young people .
-
Quality Services by embracing new technology and smart business solutions. Our roads are broken, not just the canyons and pot holes we end up negotiating on our rural roads. A patch or “stitch in time” is just a false economy. Road galleys and water management , we must work with Farmers and landowners to sort out these potential issues before the roads are impassable. High quality repairs with trained teams working round the year utilising the best materials and workmanship to deliver long term rural roads that stand up to the vagaries of our weather.
Northumberland County Council is broken with a debt burden that is unsustainable. The 4.9% increase in Council Tax will be entirely swallowed up servicing the debt that the council has accumulated.
Reform UK is a fresh alternative that is focussed on common sense policies, cutting waste and making sure your hard-earned money is spent wisely.
If you want change in Northumberland County Council, Vote Reform UK on 1st May. Together we can take back control of our local area and make it work for the bill payers in our communities not the politicians.
I hope you will give me your support to be a strong voice for our communities in this fantastic corner of Northumberland.
VOTE REFORM ON THE 1st MAY 2025

Who we are
Our website address is: https://reformnnbld.com.
Cookies
These cookies will last for one year.
If you visit our login page, we will set a temporary cookie to determine if your browser accepts cookies. This cookie contains no personal data and is discarded when you close your browser.
When you log in, we will also set up several cookies to save your login information and your screen display choices. Login cookies last for two days, and screen options cookies last for a year. If you select “Remember Me”, your login will persist for two weeks. If you log out of your account, the login cookies will be removed.
If you edit or publish an article, an additional cookie will be saved in your browser. This cookie includes no personal data and simply indicates the post ID of the article you just edited. It expires after 1 day.
Embedded content from other websites
Articles on this site may include embedded content (e.g. videos, images, articles, etc.). Embedded content from other websites behaves in the exact same way as if the visitor has visited the other website.
These websites may collect data about you, use cookies, embed additional third-party tracking, and monitor your interaction with that embedded content, including tracking your interaction with the embedded content if you have an account and are logged in to that website.
Who we share your data with
No data is collected and therfore shared with no external sources
How long we retain your data
For users that register on our website (if any), we also store the personal information they provide in their user profile. All users can see, edit, or delete their personal information at any time (except they cannot change their username). Website administrators can also see and edit that information.
What rights you have over your data
If you have an account on this site, or have left comments, you can request to receive an exported file of the personal data we hold about you, including any data you have provided to us. You can also request that we erase any personal data we hold about you. This does not include any data we are obliged to keep for administrative, legal, or security purposes.
Where your data is sent
No data is collected.
